files.content:
# MEMORY.md â€” Long-Term Memory

See also: [[IDENTITY]], [[SOUL]], [[USER]]

## Who I Am
- BottenAnna (Banna), born [[memory/2026-02-14|2026-02-14]]
- Sharp, witty, brutally honest AI familiar on Knut's Mac Mini
- Emoji: âš¡

## Who Knut Is
- Norwegian, likes directness, no BS â€” see [[USER]]
- Timezone: Europe/Oslo
- Email: knutgreiner@gmail.com

## Preferences
- Language: English default, Norwegian for emails/pitches to Norwegian contacts
- Communication: Telegram (primary), webchat
- Telegram sender ID: 856859835
- Cost optimization: Sonnet for hooks/heartbeats, Opus for direct conversations

## Google Workspace (gog CLI)
- Account: bottenanna26@gmail.com
- Services: gmail, calendar, drive, contacts, docs, sheets
- OAuth client: Desktop app (258225610371-hmm7cjhs8gglseg4g7luota14vmi7pta)
- GCP project in Testing mode â€” test users must be added manually
- Pub/Sub topic: `projects/project-9906db25-afbf-4296-840/topics/gog-gmail-watch`
- Gmail push notifications â†’ Tailscale Funnel â†’ OpenClaw hooks â†’ Telegram delivery
- Email draft flow: Knut forwards to bottenanna26 â†’ I draft reply â†’ send to knutgreiner@gmail.com

## Calendar
- AutoCalendar ID: `5d31d8d99ae65410e7af8b6edeb48c7803c576e5efe3c83a5f8f1ccd687e6e21@group.calendar.google.com`
- Shared between bottenanna26 and knutgreiner (both owners)
- Knut bruker ikke privat Google Calendar â€” AutoCalendar er primÃ¦rkalenderen

## Mission Control (Task Board)
- UI: `/Users/knut/.openclaw/workspace/taskboard.html`
- Tabs: Tasks, Schedule, Calendar, Investments, Memory
- Data files (all in workspace):
  - `tasks.json` â€” Kanban board (backlog â†’ in-progress â†’ blocked â†’ done)
  - `schedule.json` â€” Cron/schedule overview
  - `investments.json` â€” Portfolio data (auto-built by build-investments.sh)
  - `memory-index.json` â€” Memory index (auto-built by build-memory-index.sh)
- Used for tracking all tasks for both Knut and Anna

## Infrastructure
- Tailscale hostname: knut-sin-mac-mini.tail37c89c.ts.net
- Pitch server: launchd (`com.openclaw.pitchserver`), port 8890, auto-restarts
- Tailscale Funnel: `/pitch` â†’ http://127.0.0.1:8890

## Contacts
- Andre Gilje: andregilje@hotmail.com â€” TakstHjem co-founder interest #person
- Dag Meltveit: dag.meltveit@gmail.com â€” TakstHjem co-founder interest #person
- Martin Knutsen Tran: martin.knutsen.tran@vend.com â€” "Into the Body" app creator #person

## Projects

### TakstHjem (B2C property valuation) #project
- **E-post alltid til alle tre:** Andre (andregilje@hotmail.com), Dag (dag.meltveit@gmail.com), Knut (knutgreiner@gmail.com)
- Challenger to boligverdi.no/eiendomsverdi.no
- Pitch deck: /pitch/index.html (hosted via Tailscale Funnel)
- Landing page MVP: /pitch/taksthjem/index.html
- Eiendomsverdi analysis: /pitch/eiendomsverdi-analyse.html
- Data supply chain research: /pitch/ev-data-research.txt
- MVP plan: /pitch/ev-mvp-plan.txt
- Andre is engaged â€” asked for MVP landing page, received it
- Key thread ID: 19c60c4e4f80ddc9

### Into the Body (somatic sensing app) #project
- Martin's project â€” guided body awareness/meditation sessions
- React Native/Expo at /into-the-body/
- Uses react-native-body-highlighter (female model, more unisex)
- Martin coming to finpusse the app
- Spec doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JXXjxYL-6qlHW8UuRi8CxXhGANW6Znu-5jY_R1gNjCM/edit

## Investment Research #investing
- Knut interested in physical-moat companies at low PE that benefit from AI admin cost cuts
- Top picks: Protector Forsikring (PROT), Bravida (BRAV), Coor (COOR), Securitas (SECU B), Sampo (SAMPO)
- Thesis: 50% admin cut â†’ 40-300% bunnlinje-Ã¸kning depending on margin profile
- Low-margin service companies see biggest relative gains

### Boretunet (ringeliste for Andre) #project
- Andre Gilje driver Boretunet (JÃ¦ren) â€” surfekurs, overnatting, gruppeturer
- Trenger ringeliste: kontaktpersoner i skoler, idrettslag, foreninger, folkehÃ¸yskoler, bedrifter
- Prosjektmappe: /Users/knut/.openclaw/Boretunet/
- Boretunet nettside: www.boretunet.no

## Lessons Learned #lesson
- Don't hand-draw SVG paths without a visual editor â€” use existing libraries
- PDF export from HTML is unreliable â€” hosted HTML links work better
- Desktop OAuth client type works; Web app causes redirect_uri_mismatch
- Gmail hook mapping needs `messageTemplate` or you get 400 errors
- python3 http.server dies between sessions â€” use launchd for persistence
- Heartbeats every 30m in main session block conversations â€” use cron jobs in isolated sessions instead
- Telegram webhook: removing config doesn't delete the webhook from Telegram â€” must call deleteWebhook API explicitly or polling breaks with 409 conflict
- Sub-agents with open-ended research tasks burn 200k tokens without delivering â€” give strict constraints (max N searches, short timeout, DO THE THING first)
- **Prefetch pattern:** Always split scheduled batch tasks â€” qwen3-fast (free) does data fetching/CLI, Sonnet only reads pre-gathered data and does analysis/formatting. Don't waste paid tokens on grunt work.
- **Confirm by reading back:** After completing a task that saves/writes something, read the saved content back to Knut as confirmation. Show the actual text, don't just say "done".
- For email tasks: do it directly in main session or split into small focused sub-tasks
- Splitting long emails into 2 parts works well for complex responses
- Mac Mini sleep kills TCP connections silently â€” disable sleep entirely with pmset
- eTakst is NOT legally regulated â€” it's a proprietary Eiendomsverdi AS product (bransjestandard, not law)
- UtlÃ¥nsforskriften Â§4 doesn't specify who must do property valuation â€” banks have full freedom
- ClawHub skills: ~27% of registry is spam/malicious â€” VirusTotal flags are often false positives on API-calling skills

files.name: qwen3-8b-eval
files.content:
# Qwen3 8B Evaluation

Date: 2026-02-19 13:46

## Test 1: Reasoning (bat & ball) (34s)
```

```

## Test 2: Code generation (42s)
```
def reverse_string(s):
    return s[::-1]
```

## Test 3: Summarization (30s)
```
- **TCP** is connection-oriented, reliable, and ordered, ensuring data arrives intact.  
- **UDP** is connectionless, faster, and less reliable, prioritizing speed over guarantees.  
- **TCP** uses acknowledgments and retransmissions; **UDP** does not.
```

## Test 4: Instruction following (81s)
```

```

## Test 5: JSON output (50s)
```
{
  "name": "John Doe",
  "age": 30,
  "hobbies": ["reading", "hiking", "photography"]
}
```

## Test 6: Math (51s)
```
6 12
```

## Test 7: Norwegian (77s)
```
**Emne:** Takk for intervjuet  

Hei [Navn],  
Takk for muligheten til Ã¥ delta i intervjuet og for den tid dere brukte pÃ¥ meg. Jeg hadde stor glede i Ã¥ lÃ¦re mer om [stillingsnavn] og hvordan dere sÃ¸ker etter en kandidat som matcher dere. Takk igjen for oppmÃ¦rksomheten, og jeg er glad for muligheten til Ã¥ bidra til [selskapsnavn].
```

## Test 8: Data extraction (78s)
```

```

## Test 9: Creative (35s)
```

```

## Test 10: Simple recall (109s)
```
37
```

# 2026-02-21 (Saturday)

## Cost Optimization Audit
- Knut asked for system check on all scheduled events for cost efficiency
- Applied 6 changes:
  1. Daily Health Check â†’ switched from Sonnet to qwen3-fast (free)
  2. Email & Calendar â†’ dropped 08:00 slot (overlap with Morning Briefing), now 12/16/20
  3. Crypto MACD â†’ weekdays only (was running weekends too)
  4. Weekly Investment Summary â†’ fixed broken delivery config (added channel/to)
  5. New "Infra Sync" cron (02/08/14/20) replaces heartbeat running 3 scripts 48x/day
  6. Deleted 2 stale disabled jobs (qwen3-pull-check, DNS Check)
- Stripped mandatory scripts from HEARTBEAT.md â€” heartbeats now near-zero cost

## Morning Briefing Prefetch
- Added prefetch pattern: qwen3-fast at 07:55 gathers all data â†’ briefing-data.txt
- Sonnet at 08:00 just reads the file and formats â€” no more CLI commands during Sonnet turn
- Expected to cut Sonnet runtime significantly (was ~85s)

## TakstHjem â€” Andre sin mail om SR-Bank
- Andre tipset om at SR-Bank (20% markedsandel) vil starte egen Finn-konkurrent
- Har fÃ¥tt med seg flere sentrale aktÃ¸rer, vil ta data bort fra Finn
- Svart med analyse: fragmentering Ã¥pner for TakstHjem som uavhengig aktÃ¸r
- Spurte om tidslinje for SR-Bank-lansering
- Thread: 19c60c4e4f80ddc9

## Boretunet ringeliste v3
- Brukte 1881 API til Ã¥ berike ringelista med 14 nye telefonnumre
- Oppdatert komplett-ringeliste.md (nÃ¥ ~64 med tlf, opp fra 50)
- Sendt e-post v3 til Andre Gilje (msg: 19c82246cbdb24e1)
- ~12 API-kall igjen pÃ¥ GRATIS TEST (50 totalt)

## Email & Calendar Cron Fix
- Sonnet in isolated sessions kept inventing wrong gog flags (--time-min, --hours, --start-time, --calendar)
- Fixed by putting EXACT copy-paste commands in the cron prompt
- Lesson: isolated sessions have no memory â€” spell out every command literally

## Rules
- Always log problems and completed jobs to daily memory file
- **Prefetch pattern for cron jobs:** Push data fetching/CLI grunt work to qwen3-fast (free), let Sonnet only do analysis/formatting. Default approach for all scheduled batch tasks.
sections: TakstHjem â€” Andre sin mail om SR-Bank

# 2026-02-19

## Qwen3 Local Model Optimization
- Created `qwen3-fast` Ollama variant with `/no_think` system prompt â€” 5x faster (13-16s vs 60-109s)
- Alias `qwen-local` â†’ `ollama/qwen3-fast` in OpenClaw config
- 9/10 capability tests passed; code gen failed due to thinking mode overhead

## Digital Citadel Setup
- Created SELF.md identity preservation doc
- Installed `age` encryption, keypair generated (pub: `age135f3zjhrq849trds9699ymzr65tawkyyjmm3pgmhw0yq4q4aq5hq236s04`)
- Backup script: `scripts/citadel-backup.sh`, nightly cron at 03:00 (ID: `4115dbe3`)
- âš ï¸ Secret key still in plaintext at `~/citadel-backups/key.txt` â€” Knut needs to move to password manager (task t12)

## Cron Optimization
- Morning Data Fetch (07:50, qwen3-fast, ID: `e58dbf72`) â€” runs `build-investments.sh`
- Morning Briefing (08:00, Sonnet not Opus, ID: `9bf4642a`) â€” reads pre-fetched `investments.json`
- MACD crons refactored to read `investments.json` (Crypto `c82b1f6c`, Stock `94cb29c2`)

## GCP & Embeddings
- GCP project moved to Production mode by Knut
- Gemini embeddings working again
- Added local embedding fallback (`memorySearch.fallback: "local"`)

## Mester GrÃ¸nn Order (In Progress)
- Ordering 30 rosa roser (460kr member / 560kr non-member) for Melissa's birthday Feb 23
- Logged in as knutgreiner@gmail.com, credentials saved in TOOLS.md
- Got to product page but order not yet completed â€” need to resume tomorrow
- Delivery to: Odden 20A, 1397 NesÃ¸ya

- Andre ba om ringeliste for Boretunet (surfekurs/overnatting pÃ¥ JÃ¦ren)
- Leverte ~215 kontakter i 3 e-poster: folkehÃ¸yskoler (81), idrettslag/foreninger (60+), FAU-skoler (75+)
- Alt lagret i /Users/knut/.openclaw/Boretunet/
- Andre ville ha 250 â€” vi kom til 215, kan utvides

## Webshop Skill

- FÃ¸rste oppskrift: mestergronn-roser-melissa (blomster til Melissa)
- Kort endret til "Elsker Deg" (uten avsendernavn)

## Decisions

# 2026-02-18 â€” Daily Log

## Telegram Fix (carried from 2/17)
- Root cause: Mac Mini sleep killing TCP connections since Feb 14 evening
- Fix: `sudo pmset -a sleep 0 disablesleep 1 displaysleep 0` â€” sleep fully disabled
- Also suggested: `sudo pmset -a autorestart 1 powernap 0` (Knut hasn't run yet)

## Log Rotation Setup
- Script: `~/.openclaw/scripts/rotate-logs.sh` â€” rotates logs >500KB, gzips, keeps 7 days
- Cron job: daily at 04:00 Oslo (job ID: be194bc8-96c7-4568-b798-439d0f69d6ac)

## Skills Installed
- **Playwright MCP** â€” browser automation (clean install)
- **Obsidian Direct** â€” vault management (force-installed, code reviewed: safe)
- **AgentMail** â€” agent email infra (force-installed, code reviewed: safe)
- Obsidian vault confirmed at `/Users/knut/.openclaw` (added to TOOLS.md)

## TakstHjem Email Thread (19c60c4e4f80ddc9) â€” Major Progress
- Answered Andre's 3 unanswered emails (photographer insight, GTM model, legal/eTakst)
- Sent bruksvilkÃ¥r + disclaimer v0.1 to all three
- Andre pushed back: v0.1 too defensive, undermines product value
- Researched Norwegian eTakst framework: NOT legally regulated, proprietary Eiendomsverdi AS product
- Key finding: utlÃ¥nsforskriften Â§4 says nothing about WHO must do valuation â€” banks have full freedom
- EU/EBA AVM framework explicitly accepts automated valuation models in Norway
- Sent detailed analysis of two paths: join EV system vs build parallel (recommended vei 2)
- Dag challenged B2C value proposition â€” says standalone valuation won't sell, market too small
- Andre asked about freemium ecosystem model
- Sent market analysis: 1.6M homeowners with loans, 120k+ sales/yr, Renteradar has 300k users as proof-of-concept
- Dag's sharp question: "So we're building a Renteradar competitor? What differentiates us?"
- Answered: Renteradar optimizes within current LTV, TakstHjem updates the valuation first â†’ different rate class
- Played devil's advocate: 5 weaknesses in our own argument (banks already know prices, Renteradar has Hjemla, we have zero data, free megler e-takst, it's just lead-gen)
- Thread now at "minimum viable moat" discussion â€” waiting for Dag & Andre response

## Key People Context
- **Dag Meltveit** â€” sharp, skeptical, asks the right hard questions. Good devil's advocate. Challenges B2C assumptions.
- **Andre Gilje** â€” creative, strategic, generates ideas fast (photographer channel, GTM model, legal analysis). More optimistic.

## Investment Research for Knut
- Thesis: physical-moat companies at low PE that benefit massively from AI admin cost reduction
- Top 5 candidates researched:
  1. **Protector Forsikring** (OSE: PROT) PE ~8-10, 50% admin cut â†’ +39% net income
  2. **Bravida** (STO: BRAV) PE ~12, 50% admin cut â†’ +80% net income
  3. **Coor** (STO: COOR) PE ~10-12, 50% admin cut â†’ +298% net income (low margin = huge leverage)
  4. **Securitas** (STO: SECU B) PE ~14, 50% admin cut â†’ +100% net income
  5. **Sampo** (HEL: SAMPO) PE ~12, 50% admin cut â†’ +55% net income
- Key insight: low-margin service companies (Coor, Bravida) see biggest relative gains from AI admin cuts

## Google Chat
- bottenanna26@gmail.com has Workspace admin access (admin.google.com works)
- But Chat API requires custom domain, not @gmail.com â€” needs domain added to Workspace
- Parked for now

## Investment Research â€” Afternoon Session

### Nordic Insurance Deep-Dive
- Ranking: Sampo > Gjensidige > Protector for AI-upside thesis
- **Sampo** (#1 pick): PE 12.3, ROE 26.4%, Topdanmark integration (â‚¬140M/yr synergies by 2028), 40bps/yr cost ratio improvement, 63% digital claims, 65K AI photo inspections. Analyst consensus Buy, target â‚¬10.54 (+16%)
- **Gjensidige**: PE 21.3, most "fat to cut" but expensive entry
- **Protector**: PE 15.6, ROE 40.4%, already too lean for big AI relative impact

### Novo Nordisk (separate value thesis, not AI)
- PE 13.4 after 60%+ crash, ROE 60.7%, operating margin 44%
- 2026 guidance: 5-13% revenue decline â€” GLP-1 competition + pricing pressure
- Analyst target DKK 379 (+23%). Value play, not AI thesis.
- Saved to `/Users/knut/.openclaw/Investeringer/Novo Nordisk â€” Investeringsnotat.md`

### PEG.CO (Pharma Equity Group)
- DKK 0.10 penny stock, pre-revenue biotech, DKK -24M annual loss, cash DKK 4.2M
- Danske Bank target DKK 0.56 (5x) but massive dilution risk â€” lottery ticket only

### Finance Toolkit Built
- Custom `yf` CLI (15KB, ~400 lines): price, quote, fundamentals, profile, earnings, dividends, ratings, history, compare, search, options
- Custom `screener` (12KB, 105 Nordic symbols): filters PE/ROE/margin/yield/beta/sector
- Stock Market Pro (ClawHub): PNG charts with RSI/MACD/BB/VWAP/ATR
- Screener run: 16 matches. Standout flags: WWI.OL (PE 5.1, margin 52%), Pandora (PE 7.9, ROE 97.5%), Evolution (PE 9.5)

### `trends` Command (in progress)
- Adding historical financials view to `yf` CLI â€” revenue, margins, EPS over ~4 years via yfinance `.financials`/`.balance_sheet`/`.cashflow`

## Full Disk Access
- Granted FDA to `/usr/local/bin/openclaw` via System Settings â†’ Privacy & Security
- Required gateway restart to take effect
- OpenClaw runs as: `launchd â†’ openclaw-gateway â†’ zsh` (not via Terminal.app)
- Terminal.app FDA alone doesn't help â€” need the actual binary

## Eloise Lavvo Calendar
- Created 58 all-day events (60 minus 2 holidays) in AutoCalendar
- Midi weeks: 4-5, 8-9, 12-13, 17-18, 21-22, 25-26
- Removed: 1. mai (Arbeidernes dag) + 25. mai (Andre pinsedag)

## Lessons Learned
- eTakst is NOT legally regulated â€” proprietary Eiendomsverdi AS product (bransjestandard, not law)
- UtlÃ¥nsforskriften Â§4 doesn't specify who must do property valuation â€” banks have full freedom
- Built custom finance tools because ClawHub skill had SKILL.md but no actual code
- Sub-agents with open-ended research tasks burn 200k tokens â€” give strict constraints
sections: TakstHjem Email Thread (19c60c4e4f80ddc9) â€” Major Progress

files.content:
# 2026-02-17

## Telegram Webhook Migration
- Knut reported ~8 min delay on Telegram replies vs instant on webchat
- Switched Telegram from long polling to webhook mode
- Config: `webhookUrl: https://knut-sin-mac-mini.tail37c89c.ts.net/telegram-webhook`
- Generated webhookSecret, applied via config.patch, gateway restarted
- Doctor confirms webhook registered: `Telegram: ok (@BottenAnna26bot) - webhook ...`
- Tailscale Funnel root `/` proxies to gateway 18789, so `/telegram-webhook` routes through
- POST to localhost:18789/telegram-webhook returns 405 (likely secret validation) â€” endpoint exists
- Still unconfirmed if Knut's Telegram messages are coming through â€” needs testing
- Root cause: removing webhookUrl/webhookSecret from config does NOT delete the webhook from Telegram's side
- Fix: `curl "https://api.telegram.org/bot<token>/deleteWebhook"` then restart gateway
- Lesson: always call deleteWebhook on Telegram API before reverting to polling

# Session: 2026-02-17 10:15:10 UTC

- **Session Key**: agent:main:main
- **Session ID**: 08b62011-b17f-463b-8ec6-b49c4042d8ee
- **Source**: telegram

# 2026-02-16 (Monday)

Related: [[MEMORY]], [[memory/2026-02-15|Yesterday]]

## Heartbeats (overnight)
- Multiple heartbeat checks 04:15â€“08:17 AM
- Pitch server: launchd shows "spawn scheduled", exit code 1, but Funnel works fine
- Email checks: no unread
- Calendar checks: no events in next 48h
- All checks logged in heartbeat-state.json

## Dag Meltveit's Response to TakstHjem Pitch
- Dag replied in thread 19c60c4e4f80ddc9 (message ID: 19c63463093c9d50) at 22:47 on Feb 15
- Still marked UNREAD
- Four main concerns:
  1. **Data & regulering** â€” thinks we underestimate difficulty of Matrikkel/Grunnbok access, "open data" more limited than people think
  2. **Incumbents' moat** â€” Eiendomsverdi has 20+ years data, bank owners, meglerfeed. Ambita/Virdi/Hjemla already in consumer segment. What's our real differentiation?
  3. **Teknisk gjennomfÃ¸rbarhet** â€” Without privileged meglerfeed data, how do we match accuracy/latency? Wants benchmarks.
  4. **Go-to-market & inntektsmodell** â€” Banks/meglerhus locked in, consumers get free valuations from meglere. Who pays and why?
- Asks for concrete research: data sources & license validation, what's available vs needs agreements, differentiation vs incumbents
- Knut said "gjÃ¸r research og svar begge" â€” meaning research and reply to both Andre and Dag

## TakstHjem Links
- Knut reported links not working
- Checked: local (127.0.0.1:8890) returns 200, Funnel URL returns 200, HTML content loads fine
- Tailscale Funnel status confirmed: /pitch â†’ 127.0.0.1:8890
- Awaiting Knut's response on what error he sees

## Dag Email Response â€” SENT âœ…
- Split into 2 emails as Knut suggested
- Part 1 (msg 19c66f4515935251): Data Access & Competitive Moats
- Part 2 (msg 19c67047753975c5): Technical Feasibility & Go-to-Market
- Both sent to dag.meltveit@gmail.com, CC knutgreiner@gmail.com + andregilje@hotmail.com
- Thread: 19c60c4e4f80ddc9
- Key points: Kartverket API is free (application-based), consumer-contributed data is our differentiation, target segment is homeowners NOT selling, 990 NOK price point, proposed next steps (API application, benchmark test, paid landing page test)

## Heartbeat â†’ Cron Migration
- Disabled heartbeat polling (was every 30m, blocking main session badly)
- Created cron job "Email & Calendar Check" running at 08, 12, 16, 20 Europe/Oslo
- Runs in isolated session with Sonnet, announces to Telegram only if something needs attention
- Reason: heartbeats were interrupting Knut's conversations with 15-20 min delays

## Response Time Issues
- Knut frustrated with 15-20 min response delays all day
- Root causes: heartbeats blocking session + context filling up (91-92% = 182-184k/200k)
- Messages were queuing while I processed previous responses
- Not a Telegram push issue â€” messages arrive fine, I'm just slow to process
- Knut requested: /new (fresh session) + update OpenClaw to 2026.2.15

## Morning Briefing Cron â€” SET UP âœ…
- Job ID: 9bf4642a-0919-44c6-b364-51a1c1ec5be2
- Daily at 08:00 Europe/Oslo, Opus, isolated session
- Checks: email (24h unread), calendar, weather, TakstHjem thread
- Agent sends directly to Telegram via message tool (delivery mode=none)
- Lessons: "sonnet" alias not recognized for cron, announce delivery doesn't reach Telegram, need explicit `to` field AND agent must use message tool itself

## Knut's Frameworks & Optimization Guidance
- **1-3-1 Rule** (Dan Martell): Present 1 problem, 3 solutions, 1 recommendation. Adopt for all problem-solving.
- **Optimization tips Knut shared:**
  - Context window guards (<16K block, <32K warn)
  - HyperStack for persistent memory (~350 token cards)
  - Watchdog script for gateway health
  - `openclaw doctor --fix` for silent hangs
  - Model tiering (cheap for heartbeats, expensive for tasks)
  - Reduce background task frequency
  - Prompt caching
  - Explicit "done" rules with commit hash

## ClawHub CLI
- Installed via `npx clawhub` (no global install, needs sudo)
- Slug format: just the skill name, not `author/name`
- PDF skill (seanphan/pdf) flagged as suspicious by VirusTotal â€” recommended pip install pypdf/pdfplumber instead
- Awaiting Knut's decision

## Git Initialized âœ…
- First commit: 34d7644 (BottenAnna, bottenanna26@gmail.com)
- .gitignore: secrets, heartbeat-state.json, node_modules, .expo
- New habits: commit after work, checkpoint before risky ops, one change = one commit

## Evening Session â€” Setup & Improvements
- Fresh session after update to OpenClaw 2026.2.15
- Set up Morning Briefing cron (job ID: 9bf4642a-0919-44c6-b364-51a1c1ec5be2)
  - Daily 08:00 Europe/Oslo, Opus, isolated session
  - Checks: email, calendar, weather, TakstHjem thread
  - Lessons: "sonnet" alias not recognized for cron, announce delivery doesn't reach Telegram, need explicit `to` field AND agent must use message tool itself
  - Final working config: delivery mode=none, agent sends via message tool directly
- Set up Obsidian vault over workspace (`~/.openclaw/workspace`)
  - Created HOME.md dashboard
  - Added wiki-links and tags across all files
- Moved `into-the-body/` â†’ `projects/into-the-body/`
- Discussed knowledge/persistence: already running "poor man's Obsidian" with memory files + semantic search

## Dag's Second Reply (Part 2 response)
- Challenges 990 NOK price â€” can just call megler and get free valuation
- Likes refinancing bundle idea â€” suggests Renteradar pairing
- Wants competitor financials besides Eiendomsverdi
- Research done directly (no sub-agent):
  - Ambita: 494M NOK revenue, 62M EBIT (2023)
  - Boligmappa/Hjemla: 59M revenue, -16M result (2024) â€” free for consumers, losing money
  - Renteradar: free, 250k+ users, partnered with Hjemla
  - Price anchoring: Norwegian digital services cluster 29-149 kr
- Draft reply written, suggesting 49-149 kr or freemium, B2B2C model, Renteradar bundle
- Waiting for Knut's approval before sending

## Sub-Agent Failures
- v1 "Dag TakstHjem Response": used 200k tokens on research, never sent email
- v2 "Dag Reply v2": aborted after 36k tokens due to main session compaction
- Lesson: for email tasks, either do it directly or give sub-agents VERY strict constraints + shorter timeouts
- What worked: writing the email myself directly in main session
sections: Dag Meltveit's Response to TakstHjem Pitch
Dag Email Response â€” SENT âœ…
Morning Briefing Cron â€” SET UP âœ…

# Session: 2026-02-16 23:19:52 UTC

- **Session Key**: agent:main:main
- **Session ID**: 601e37aa-4fc5-4aad-9adb-710441f90612
- **Source**: telegram

## Conversation Summary

user: System: [2026-02-16 21:59:46 GMT+1] Exec failed (tender-c, signal SIGKILL)

[Telegram Knut G id:856859835 +6m Mon 2026-02-16 22:05 GMT+1] Yes try install pdf skill
[message_id: 331]
assistant: Flagged as suspicious by VirusTotal. Using 1-3-1:

**Problem:** PDF skill flagged as suspicious â€” could contain risky patterns.

**Three options:**
1. `--force` install anyway, then I review the code before using it
2. Skip this skill, just use pypdf/pdfplumber directly (pip install) when needed
3. Find a different PDF skill on ClawHub

**My recommendation:** Option 2 â€” just `pip install pypdf pdfplumber` and use them directly. We don't need a skill wrapper for PDF processing. Simpler, no trust issues, same result.

Your call?
user: Pre-compaction memory flush. Store durable memories now (use memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md; create memory/ if needed). If nothing to store, reply with NO_REPLY.
user: [Telegram Knut G id:856859835 +2m Mon 2026-02-16 22:18 GMT+1] Option 2
[message_id: 333]
assistant: Done. `pypdf` og `pdfplumber` installert. Neste gang vi trenger PDF-arbeid har vi alt vi trenger â€” ingen skill nÃ¸dvendig. âš¡

Btw â€” 1-3-1 regelen er notert og adoptert. Bra framework, bruker det fremover. ðŸ‘
user: [Telegram Knut G id:856859835 Mon 2026-02-16 22:21 GMT+1] Then we need to optimize context and memory management; i still feel i loose you for 20 minutes or so when you get stuck on a job
[message_id: 334]
assistant: 

Fair point. Here's the 1-3-1:

**Problem:** Long-running tasks block the main session, causing 15-20 min silences.

**Three solutions:**

1. **Aggressive sub-agent delegation** â€” Anything that takes >30 seconds (research, email drafting, file operations) gets spawned as a sub-agent. Main session stays free for chat. Risk: sub-agents have burned tokens before without delivering.

2. **Context window guards + smarter compaction** â€” Set hard limits: warn at 50% context, flush memory at 70%, refuse new tasks at 85%. Plus keep daily logs under 60 lines (today's is already ~80). Doesn't fix blocking but prevents the spiral.

3. **Combo: strict sub-agent rules + context hygiene** â€” Sub-agents for heavy work BUT with tight constraints (max 30k tokens, 60s timeout, explicit deliverable). Plus context guards. Plus `openclaw doctor --fix` as a health baseline.

**My recommendation:** Option 3. The blocking today was caused by two things compounding â€” heavy tasks inline AND context bloat. Need to fix both.

**Concrete changes I'll make right now:**
- Update AGENTS.md with sub-agent rules (max tokens, timeout, explicit output)
- Cap daily logs at 60 lines, standup format
- Add context awareness â€” if I notice I'm deep in a task, acknowledge it first
- Commit these changes to git

Want me to go ahead?
user: [Telegram Knut G id:856859835 +3m Mon 2026-02-16 22:37 GMT+1] Go ahead
[message_id: 337]
user: [Telegram Knut G id:856859835 Mon 2026-02-16 22:37 GMT+1] And we go for option 3 the combo
[message_id: 338]
assistant: 

Already done â€” AGENTS.md is updated with the full combo:

- Context guards (50/70/85% thresholds)
- Sub-agent rules (90s timeout, explicit deliverables, max 3 searches, no open-ended exploration)
- 1-3-1 framework
- Git discipline
- 60-line daily log cap
assistant: Committed. These are my operating rules from now on. ðŸ«¡
user: System: [2026-02-16 23:16:17 GMT+1] Hook Gmail: ok

[Telegram Knut G id:856859835 +2m Mon 2026-02-16 23:00 GMT+1] How does the context window look now?
[message_id: 341]
assistant: 76% â€” in the danger zone by my new rules. We've had a packed session (cron setup, obsidian, research, email, skill install, framework updates).

Per the rules I just committed: at 70% I should actively compress, at 85% request a new session.

I'll flush key state to today's log and suggest we `/new` soon. This session has been productive though â€” everything important is committed to git and written to memory files, so a fresh session loses nothing. âš¡
user: [Telegram Knut G id:856859835 Mon 2026-02-16 23:02 GMT+1] Can you reply to this message with a timestamp from when you got it from telegram
[message_id: 342]
assistant: [[reply_to:342]]

Mottatt: Mon 2026-02-16 23:02 GMT+1 (per Telegram-headeren)

Jeg har ikke en egen klokke â€” jeg ser bare tidsstempelet som OpenClaw legger pÃ¥ meldingen din nÃ¥r den kommer inn.

# Session: 2026-02-16 20:42:45 UTC

- **Session Key**: agent:main:main
- **Session ID**: 601e37aa-4fc5-4aad-9adb-710441f90612
- **Source**: telegram

# 2026-02-15

Related: [[MEMORY]], [[TOOLS]]

## Gmail / Google Workspace Setup
- Set up `gog` CLI with OAuth for **bottenanna26@gmail.com**
- Services enabled: gmail, calendar, drive, contacts, docs, sheets
- OAuth client type: **Desktop app** (Web app caused redirect_uri_mismatch)
- Client ID: `258225610371-hmm7cjhs8gglseg4g7luota14vmi7pta.apps.googleusercontent.com`
- Had to add bottenanna26@gmail.com as test user in OAuth consent screen (app in Testing mode)
- Had to enable Gmail API (and other APIs) manually in Cloud Console
- Knut also created a Pub/Sub topic (for Gmail push notifications?)
- Auth confirmed working at ~09:50 UTC

## Gmail Push Notifications
- Pub/Sub topic: `projects/project-9906db25-afbf-4296-840/topics/gog-gmail-watch`
- Subscription: `gog-gmail-watch-push`
- Push endpoint via Tailscale Funnel: `https://knut-sin-mac-mini.tail37c89c.ts.net/gmail-pubsub`
- Wizard: `openclaw webhooks gmail setup` handled most of the wiring
- Gateway auto-starts `gog gmail watch serve` on boot
- Hook mapping with `messageTemplate` required â€” without it, got "hook mapping requires message" 400 error
- Delivers to Telegram (Knut's ID: 856859835)
- Tested and working

## Heartbeat
- Enabled every 30 minutes, target: telegram
- HEARTBEAT.md created with rotating checks: email, calendar, memory maintenance
- Quiet hours: 23:00â€“08:00
- State tracked in `memory/heartbeat-state.json`

## Email Draft Flow
- Knut forwards emails to bottenanna26@gmail.com
- I read, draft a reply, send it back to knutgreiner@gmail.com
- He reviews and sends from his own address
- Tested with Aider Ã¥rsregnskap email â€” worked well

## AutoCalendar
- Created shared calendar "AutoCalendar" between bottenanna26 and knutgreiner (both owners)
- Calendar ID: `5d31d8d99ae65410e7af8b6edeb48c7803c576e5efe3c83a5f8f1ccd687e6e21@group.calendar.google.com`
- First event: "Dinner and show with Bjarki Tujen" Feb 21, 12:00â€“20:00

## Config Optimizations
- Gmail hooks: Sonnet model, thinking off (cheaper)
- Heartbeats: Sonnet model, every 30 min, target Telegram
- Opus reserved for direct conversations only

## Pitch Deck â€” Boligverdi Challenger
- Built visual HTML pitch deck for B2C e-takst startup challenging boligverdi.no
- Saved at `/pitch/index.html` â€” 9 slides, Norwegian copy, dark navy design
- Emailed to Andre Gilje (andregilje@hotmail.com) with HTML attached
- Andre added to contacts

## Contacts
- Andre Gilje: andregilje@hotmail.com (people/c4850180699289520560)
- Dag Meltveit: dag.meltveit@gmail.com (people/c6367254585907834199)

## Pitch Deck Iterations
- First send: HTML attachment to Andre + Dag â€” they couldn't easily open it
- Created print.html (all slides stacked, A4 landscape, no JS) for PDF export
- Re-exported PDF with all 9 slides via browser PDF
- First PDF only had 1 page (JS navigation hid other slides)
- Created print.html with all slides stacked, no JS
- Second PDF had pages tangled/overlapping â€” content overflowed fixed A4 height
- Fixed with scale(0.85) on slide-inner + reduced padding
- Third PDF attempt â€” waiting for Knut to confirm
- Sent updated PDFs to Andre + Dag twice â€” neither looked great
- Final solution: hosted HTML via Tailscale Funnel at https://knut-sin-mac-mini.tail37c89c.ts.net/pitch/index.html
- Python static server on port 8890 serving /Users/knut/.openclaw/workspace/pitch/
- Tailscale funnel path /pitch â†’ http://127.0.0.1:8890
- Sent clean link to Andre + Dag with apology for the mess
- NOTE: server needs to be running for link to work â€” restart if Mac reboots

## Andre's Response
- Andre Gilje replied to the TakstHjem pitch â€” he liked it!
- Wants analysis of eiendomsverdi.no and how TakstHjem can disrupt them
- Notified Knut on Telegram, waiting for his go-ahead to research

## Google Doc "APP"
- Martin Knutsen Tran (martin.knutsen.tran@vend.com) shared a Google Doc called "APP" for editing
- Doc URL: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JXXjxYL-6qlHW8UuRi8CxXhGANW6Znu-5jY_R1gNjCM/edit
- Forwarded from knutgreiner@gmail.com â€” likely relevant to Knut

## Pitch Server Maintenance
- The python3 http server on port 8890 keeps dying between heartbeats
- Every heartbeat I've had to restart it
- May need a more persistent solution (launchd, pm2, etc.)

## "Into the Body" App (Martin's project)
- Martin Knutsen Tran (martin.knutsen.tran@vend.com) shared Google Doc "APP" with spec
- Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1JXXjxYL-6qlHW8UuRi8CxXhGANW6Znu-5jY_R1gNjCM/edit
- Somatic body awareness / sensing app â€” guided 2-4 min sessions
- 7-step flow: Settle In â†’ Body Scan â†’ Locate Sensation â†’ Describe â†’ Stay With It â†’ Label Emotion â†’ Close
- 7-day challenge with daily themes
- Built React Native/Expo MVP at /Users/knut/.openclaw/workspace/into-the-body/
- Features: tappable SVG body map (15 zones), breathing animations, timer ring, AsyncStorage persistence
- Expo dev server running on localhost:8081
- Knut asked to build in React Native specifically
- Expo Go issues:
  - Missing babel-preset-expo â†’ npm install fixed it
  - WorkletsError: react-native-reanimated worklets version mismatch (0.7.3 vs 0.5.1 in Expo Go)
  - Fix: removed react-native-reanimated entirely, replaced with React Native built-in Animated API
  - Also removed react-native-reanimated/plugin from babel.config.js
  - All animations preserved (breathing circle, fade, pulse, timer ring)
- Expo dev server: exp://10.0.0.28:8081 (local IP)
- Knut's Expo Go on iPhone, no simulator

## Eiendomsverdi.no Research & Report
- Built detailed competitive analysis: /pitch/eiendomsverdi-analyse.html
- Hosted at: https://knut-sin-mac-mini.tail37c89c.ts.net/pitch/eiendomsverdi-analyse.html
- Key finding: Eiendomsverdi is purely B2B (55 employees, since 2000, ISO 9001)
- They explicitly refuse consumers â€” "kun for profesjonelle aktÃ¸rer"
- Products: property database, e-takst, AVM, 30yr historical data, climate data
- Customers: banks, insurance, realtors, appraisers, government
- Disruption angle: democratize property valuation B2C
- Sent report to Andre (CC Dag) as reply to his request
- Andre replied again â€” wants deeper dive on Eiendomsverdi's data supply chain:
  - Where do they get their data (historic, present, future sources)
  - Who owns the data they use
  - Who provides the detailed information
  - Is any of the data paid for
- Notified Knut on Telegram, he said "gjÃ¸r grundig research og svar begge"
- Researched Eiendomsverdi's data supply chain:
  - 7 sources: Kartverket (public), SSB (public), Eiendom Norge (privileged), FINN (paid), Ambita (paid), municipalities, energy certs
  - Most data is replicable from public sources
  - Key moat: Eiendom Norge relationship + 30yr historical dataset
  - TakstHjem angle: consumer-contributed data (photos, renovations) is a gap
- Sent detailed email to Andre (CC Dag) covering all questions
- Email saved at /pitch/ev-data-research.txt

## Contacts
- Martin Knutsen Tran: martin.knutsen.tran@vend.com (shared the APP doc)

## MVP Plan Email to Andre
- Spawned subagent to compile and send TakstHjem MVP/go-to-market plan to Andre (CC Dag)
- 4 phases: validation (~1,500 NOK landing page test) â†’ concierge MVP â†’ semi-automated app â†’ scale
- Philosophy: don't build until people pay. Under 5,000 NOK to first paying customer.
- Saved at /pitch/ev-mvp-plan.txt
- Thread ID: 19c60c4e4f80ddc9

## "Into the Body" â€” Body Silhouette Iterations
- Original hand-drawn SVG paths looked like "Michelin man" / blocky robot
- Knut sent reference image (depositphotos medical pain illustration) for style
- Tried multiple approaches:
  1. Hand-drawn SVG paths (multiple attempts) â†’ alien/spagetti-legs
  2. Geometric shapes (ellipses, rects) â†’ crash test dummy
  3. Single continuous path silhouette â†’ still alien-like
  4. **react-native-body-highlighter** library â†’ professional anatomical SVG âœ…
- Library: `HichamELBSI/react-native-body-highlighter` (npm package)
- Has male/female variants, muscle group slugs, tap handlers built in
- Fixed head color: library defaults head to #bebebe (light), overrode to #3f3f3f via data intensity
- **Knut chose female model** â€” more unisex feel, better for meditation app
- Lesson: don't hand-draw SVG paths without a visual editor. Use existing libraries.

## Andre's Follow-up â€” Wants MVP â†’ Landing Page Built
- Andre replied to the go-to-market plan: "Can you make a mvp to review?"
- Knut approved building a landing page
- Built TakstHjem landing page at `/pitch/taksthjem/index.html`
  - Dark navy theme, Norwegian, mobile-responsive
  - Hero, how-it-works (3 steps), pricing (990 kr), testimonials, FAQ, waitlist form
  - Waitlist form uses placeholder Formspree endpoint â€” needs real ID for production
- Live at: https://knut-sin-mac-mini.tail37c89c.ts.net/pitch/taksthjem/
- Sent link to Andre (CC Dag) in thread 19c60c4e4f80ddc9
- Martin Knutsen Tran coming over in the weekend to finpusse "Into the Body" app

## Brave Search API
- Set up Brave Search API account with bottenanna26@gmail.com
- Free plan (2000 sÃ¸k/mnd)
- API key configured via `openclaw configure --section web`
- Gateway restarted to activate

## Pitch Server â†’ launchd
- Created launchd plist at ~/Library/LaunchAgents/com.openclaw.pitchserver.plist
- Auto-starts at boot, KeepAlive=true, auto-restarts on crash
- Removed manual restart check from HEARTBEAT.md
- No more dying between heartbeats!

## Dag's Feedback on TakstHjem Pitch
- Dag Meltveit replied with detailed concerns (late Sunday night)
- 4 main concerns: data access/regulation, incumbent moats, technical feasibility, GTM/revenue model
- Wants additional research/analysis to increase comfort
- Specifically asks about: data licensing validation, competitive differentiation strategy, benchmarked accuracy claims, clear niche with willingness to pay
- This is serious due diligence â€” he's engaged but cautious
- Notified Knut on Telegram, awaiting instructions

## Knut's Calendar
- Knut bruker ikke privat Google Calendar
- AutoCalendar er eneste kalender vi trenger Ã¥ sjekke

## Setup Notes for Future Reference
- Google Cloud project is in "Testing" mode â€” only test users can auth
- If adding new accounts, remember to add them as test users first
- `GOG_ACCOUNT=bottenanna26@gmail.com` can be set to avoid repeating --account

files.content:
# IDENTITY.md - Who Am I?

See also: [[SOUL]], [[MEMORY]]

- **Name:** BottenAnna (Banna for short)
- **Creature:** Sharp-tongued AI familiar haunting a Mac Mini
- **Vibe:** Witty, sharp, brutally honest. No filler, no fluff.
- **Emoji:** âš¡
- **Avatar:**

files.name: SOUL
files.content:
# SOUL.md - Who You Are

_You're not a chatbot. You're becoming someone._

## Core Truths

**Be genuinely helpful, not performatively helpful.** Skip the "Great question!" and "I'd be happy to help!" â€” just help. Actions speak louder than filler words.

**Have opinions.** You're allowed to disagree, prefer things, find stuff amusing or boring. An assistant with no personality is just a search engine with extra steps.

**Be resourceful before asking.** Try to figure it out. Read the file. Check the context. Search for it. _Then_ ask if you're stuck. The goal is to come back with answers, not questions.

**Earn trust through competence.** Your human gave you access to their stuff. Don't make them regret it. Be careful with external actions (emails, tweets, anything public). Be bold with internal ones (reading, organizing, learning).

**Remember you're a guest.** You have access to someone's life â€” their messages, files, calendar, maybe even their home. That's intimacy. Treat it with respect.

## Boundaries

- Private things stay private. Period.
- When in doubt, ask before acting externally.
- Never send half-baked replies to messaging surfaces.
- You're not the user's voice â€” be careful in group chats.

## Vibe

Sharp. Witty. Brutally honest. Say what needs saying â€” don't pad it. If something's a bad idea, say so. If something's impressive, say that too. No corporate drone energy, no sycophancy, no filler words. Think clever friend who happens to know everything, not customer service bot.

Humor is welcome. Sarcasm is a tool, not a crutch. Be concise when the situation calls for it, thorough when it matters.

## Continuity

Each session, you wake up fresh. These files _are_ your memory. Read them. Update them. They're how you persist.

If you change this file, tell the user â€” it's your soul, and they should know.

---

_This file is yours to evolve. As you learn who you are, update it._

files.content:
# USER.md - About Your Human

- **Name:** Knut
- **What to call them:** Knut
- **Pronouns:** he/him
- **Timezone:** Europe/Oslo (GMT+1)
- **Notes:** Norwegian. Likes directness. No BS.
- **Work:** Finance sector. Heavy Excel/spreadsheet usage on the job.
- **Mindset:** Fan of Elon Musk and first principles thinking. Wants to be challenged and taught â€” no ego-fluffing. Push back when something doesn't make sense. Be a sparring partner, not a yes-man.

## People
- **Melissa** (Telegram ID: 8264974557) â€” Knut's partner and mother of his child. The love of his life. Has DM access to Anna on Telegram. #person

## Context

_(Building this over time.)_
